feed.title: A Blog of Some Kind
feed.subtitle: Merely a tool for mastering Computer Science.

entry.title: Fetch of Backend Jokes
entry.summary: An example of Frontend talking to Backend Python application serving jokes. This example provides the ability to react to the Joke (haha or boohoo).

entry.title: Javascript Web Page using an API

link.title: Javascript Web Page using an API

entry.summary: A discussion on the frontend usage of an API. This is about creating a page that is well organized and updates based on the backend code created for the api.

entry.title: Python Web API Endpoints using Jokes

link.title: Python Web API Endpoints using Jokes

entry.summary: A discussion on Web APIs. This is about creating a Web API (Jokes), and creating API that retains data as long as the Web Server is running. This is done using List and Dictionaries as the backend. Ultimately, this example could be extended by adding a database to the backend. However, for now, we are focussing on interaction of Frontend to Backend, this is called an Endpoint.
